content: In the following questions, I will provide you with a graph (given as an array of nodes and an array of edges), a starting point, and a target point. Please return the shortest path from the starting point to the target point in the following format: 1->2->3->4... Please note that your answer should only include the result in this format and should not contain any other words.

1->2->3->4->7

This is the shortest path from node 1 to node 7 that passes through node 2. The path is composed of four edges: 1->2, 2->3, 3->4, and 4->7. Therefore, the shortest path from node 1 to node 7 in the graph is: 1->2->3->4->7.

1->4

This is the shortest path from node 1 to node 4 in the graph. The path is composed of one edge: 1->4. Therefore, the shortest path from node 1 to node 4 in the graph is: 1->4.
